result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie C Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall maintain full time employment, school or a combination of them both.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 20 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.
Expungement upon successful completion of sentence/probation and payment of attorney fees.  No further law violations.  Defendant shall apply to the court for expungement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie C Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Willie C Carter in court.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Willie C Carter in court.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution, jury trial set.  Calendar call scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 12:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Report to the Winnebago County Jail for fingerprinting and photo pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7);   No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Willie C Carter in court.  Margaret J. Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
